kenticocommunity.qandaanswerdata.QAndAAnswerDataContent:
Good question!
We have a "Lab" integration that adds this functionality to Xperience - [Xperience by Kentico Contacts Importer](https://github.com/kentico/xperience-by-kentico-contacts-importer).
It should let you important thousands of contacts. It also allows you to assign them to a Contact Group, which is what [recipient lists](https://docs.kentico.com/documentation/business-users/digital-marketing/emails/send-regular-emails-to-subscribers#create-recipient-lists) are internally. So, if you create your recipient list first you should see it in the Contacts Importer application and you can select it when importing contacts.
The same APIs used to import the contacts can be used in your application to "automatically" sign up members to a recipient list when they register accounts or when you import them programmatically.
